document.title: Back from the camp!
document.author: NiKo
document.text:
Im back from the symfony camp 2008 . Its been a really great pleasure to meet the community [ 1 ] , there are so many smart people using symfony all around the world, its just amazing.
I gave a one day training session on symfony 1.1 to eleven attendees the day before, I think it was somewhat interesting even if it may have been too short to see every important aspects of the framework
The conferences were also great, and some slides are already available:
Edit: Opening Conference, by Lambert Beekhuis Be RESTful, by Fabien Potencier Beyond symfony 1.2, by Fabien Full Stack Web Application Performance Tuning, by Fabian Lange Debugging with symfony, by Stefan Koopmanschap The symfony Admin Generator, by Ian P. Christian Edit: Lessons Learned at Yahoo!, by Dustin Whittle Edit: Using YUI with symfony, by Dustin Whittle Edit: Developing for Developer, by Francois Zaninotto
Stefan has also taken some shots of the event .
Last and as a side note, as of now all my symfony related posts will be written in English, as its the main language used by the community. Notes [ 1 ] even if the weather was well, dutch wet
